intro: Diasperus neogranatensis, commonly known as the Neogranatense Diasperus, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a warm, humid climate for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
